ETSI FSK

ETS 300 778-1

This European Telecommunication Standard (ETS) specifies the electrical characteristics, the functional characteristics and the corresponding conformance tests for Terminal Equipment (TE) for connection to the network termination points of a Public Switched Telephone Network (PSTN) interface providing a Protocol over the local loop for display and related services based on the protocols defined in ETS 300 659-1.

Signalling format

Data transmission to the TE is by means of the Frequency Shift Keying (FSK) method based upon CCITT Recommendation V.23

Signalling frequencies

The TE shall be capable of correctly receiving FSK signalling tones within the following frequency ranges;

  • mark frequency: 1300 Hz +/-1.5 %
  • space frequency: 2100 Hz +/- 1.5 % at a rate of 1200 bits/s +/- 1 %.

Signalling levels

The TE shall be capable of correctly receiving FSK signalling tones with levels within the range -8 to -36 dBV
A twist between the mark and space tones not exceeding 6 dB

Data transmission associated with ringing

The data transmission can either precede the normal ring pattern or occur during the first long silent period during normal ring pattern

Data transmission prior to ringing

the TE shall correctly detect one or more of the following types of TAS:

  • Dual Tone Alerting Signal (DT-AS)
  • Ringing Pulse Alerting Signal (RP-AS)
  • A line reversal followed by a Dual Tone Alerting Signal (DT-AS)

Dual Tone Alerting Signal (DT-AS)


DT-AS signal characteristics

  • Nominal frequencies: 2130 Hz and 2750 Hz +/- 0.5 %
  • Signal level: -9 to -40 dBV/tone
  • Twist: 6 dB max
  • Duration: 100 ms +/- 10 ms

Dual Tone Alerting Signal (DT-AS) preceding the FSK data transmission

Ringing Pulse Alerting Signal (RP-AS)


Ringing Pulse Alerting Signal (RP-AS) preceding the FSK data transmission

Line reversal followed by a DT-AS


Line reversal followed by Dual Tone Alerting Signal (DT-AS) preceding the FSK transmission

Data transmission during ringing

For TE intended to operate with data transmission during ringing, the TE shall correctly detect a first ring pattern with a duration of 350 ms to 1 200 ms and an amplitude in the range 30 V rms to 90 V rms, at a frequency of 25 Hz and/or 50 Hz

  • T5: From first ring pattern to start of FSK data transmission
    2000ms > T5 >= 500ms
  • T6: From end of FSK data transmission to second ring pattern
    T6 >= 200ms

    Data transmission during ringing

Data transmission not associated with ringing

For TE intended to operate where data transmission is not associated with ringing.

Timing parameters

The values of timing parameters T0, T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6 and T7 are defined in ETS 300 659-1. The definitions are shown below.
